content: i do not know about your cats but all cats i know absolutely adore sleeping on knitted fabric does not matter if spiky needles are still coming out of everywhere it is cozy warm and smells mike human perfect for snuggles welcome the solution to this cute but rather annoying habit of your furry pet yes dogs love it as well but you might need to scale up a bit you can put it next to you on a couch on the windowsill into their baskets or beds it s perfect to keep them warm and energetically connected to you it can also become a unique design element in your interior well enough talking let s start **yarn** any scrap or leftover yarn would do either any 2 stands of aran weight yarn held together or 1 strand of bulky yarn of your choice i used 2 strands of aran weight held together the finished cushion is 170 g which is ca 3 5 skeins of aran weight yarn with 90-100 m in 50 g **needles and notion** 4 mm g crochet hook at least 1 or a few stitch marker s use a hook suitable to the yarn you use **gauge** 8 5 - 9 single_crochet stitches in 10 cm /4 in **final measurements** 34 cm 13 4 in long 27 cm 10 6 in wide **construction** this cushion in made of 2 identical oval pieces worked with single_crochet in a round and joined together afterwards which makes it sturdy durable and warm
